PARAMS.INSERTPARAM12: this is a very bad thing to say indeed
PARAMS.ERRORTEXT1: This setting must be a positive number. Note: the use of decimal places is not supported.

TEXTBOX.label: Immediate Disqualifier - enter words and phrases that if present, will prevent the policy from matching the section of the event in which they are found.
Threshold Value - enter a number to override the default threshold value.

Positive Indicators - enter names or numbers relating to accounts or individuals involved in possible anti-money laundering behavior that should trigger policy. You may also enter words or phrases being used in lieu of industry terms to mask the existence of such actions.

Negative Indicators - enter disclaimer text and other organization specific information as it appears in an event where it triggered policy incorrectly. Commas in disclaimers must be entered with a leading \.

SELECT.label: Sensitivity Setting - select a setting that determines the Sensitivity Setting of the policy.
Enter a severity that will be assigned to incidents violating this policy

TEXTBOX.label: Message To Users - enter the text that the user will see if an action that results in a notification is selected.
$addresses$
Excluded Search Text - enter words or phrases that will prevent policy from being applied to any section of an e-mail if found in the subject.
Included Addresses - enter addresses of recipients to which policy should be applied.
This field is used for information classification purposes. All events identified by this policy will be tagged using the text value entered.
Enter a numeric value into this field. Any message that has more external recipients than this value will trigger the policy.
Excluded File Names - enter file types to be excluded from policy using the format *.filetype. Multiple entries must be separated by a comma.
Positive Indicators - enter fully qualified e-mail names or e-mail addresses of senior managers whose messages should not be forwarded.
Minimum E-mail Size - enter numeric value as minimum e-mail size (in KB - kilobytes) required to trigger policy.
Sampling Rate - enter a number that will determine at what rate this policy will fire.
Enter a numeric value into this field. Any message that has more attachments than this value will trigger the policy.

SELECT.label: Enter a severity that will be assigned to incidents violating this policy.

TEXTBOX.label: Message To Users - enter the text that the user will see if an action that results in a notification is selected.
Excluded File Names - enter file types to be excluded from policy using the format *.filetype. Multiple entries must be separated by a comma.

INTEGERBOX.label: Minimum File Size - enter a minimum file size (in bytes) needed to trigger policy.

TEXTBOX.label: This field is used for information classification purposes. All events identified by this policy will be tagged using the text value entered.

INTEGERBOX.label: Print Job Size - enter numeric value as minimum number of pages that can be printed before triggering the warning.

SELECT.label: Enter a severity that will be assigned to incidents violating this policy.

TEXTBOX.label: Stub File Content - enter the text that the user will see when a 'Replace with Stub File' action is activated.
Excluded File Names - enter file types to be excluded from policy using the format *.filetype. Multiple entries must be separated by a comma.

INTEGERBOX.label: Minimum File Size - enter a minimum file size (in bytes) needed to trigger policy.

TEXTBOX.label: This field is used for information classification purposes. All events identified by this policy will be tagged using the text value entered.

SELECT.label: Enter a severity that will be assigned to incidents violating this policy

TEXTBOX.label: Message To Users - enter the text that the user will see if an action that results in a notification is selected.
Excluded URLs - enter URLs of sites to be excluded from the application of this policy. Multiple entries must be separated by a comma.
This field is used for information classification purposes. All events identified by this policy will be tagged using the text value entered.
Global Copy File To Location - enter a valid UNC or local file system path to copy file(s) that trigger all Data At Rest policies.
Global Copy File To Location - enter a valid UNC or local file system path to copy file(s) that trigger all Data At Rest policies.
Global Copy File To Location - enter a valid UNC or local file system path to copy file(s) that trigger all Data At Rest policies.

SUB_TREE_NODE.label: Action Configuration - Data In Motion - E-mail

TEXTBOX.label: Global Forward To - enter the e-mail address for the recipient of forwarded e-mails.
Global Forward To - enter the e-mail address for the recipient of forwarded e-mails.
Global Forward To - enter the e-mail address for the recipient of forwarded e-mails.
Global Forward To - enter the e-mail address for the recipient of forwarded e-mails.
Global Forward To - enter the e-mail address for the recipient of forwarded e-mails.
Enter the name of the security officer who will be responsible for fielding any questions related to security violations.
Enter the phone extension of the security officer who will be responsible for fielding any questions related to security violations.
Global Internal Domains - enter the list of e-mail domains that are considered internal to your organization e.g. internal.com. Multiple entries must be separated by a comma.
Global Subject Excludes - enter words or phrases that will prevent policy from being applied to any section of an e-mail if found in the subject.
Global Immediate Disqualifier - enter words and phrases that if present, will prevent the policy from matching the section of the event in which they are found.
Global File Exclude List - enter file types to be globally excluded from policy using the following format *.filetype.

INTEGERBOX.label: Maximum Size of Email Distribution Lists - Specify a threshold number of list members. After expanding this number of recipients from the distribution list, or if expanding a nested distribution list would exceed this number, no further individual recipients are extracted.
